Two-sided ray inequalities force affine behavior along the direction.

lemma ray_eq_of_ineq_pair {n : Nat} {f : (Fin n Real) Real} {y : Fin n Real} {v : Real} (hpos : x : Fin n Real, t : Real, 0 t f (x + t y) f x + t * v) (hneg : x : Fin n Real, t : Real, 0 t f (x + t (-y)) f x + t * (-v)) : x : Fin n Real, t : Real, f (x + t y) = f x + t * v := by intro x t by_cases ht : 0 t have hle : f (x + t y) f x + t * v := hpos x t ht have hge : f x + t * v f (x + t y) := by have hneg' := hneg (x + t y) t ht simpa [smul_neg, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc] using hneg' exact le_antisymm hle hge have htneg : t < 0 := lt_of_not_ge ht set s : Real := -t have hs : 0 s := by linarith have hle : f (x + s (-y)) f x + s * (-v) := hneg x s hs have hge : f x + s * (-v) f (x + s (-y)) := by have hpos' := hpos (x + s (-y)) s hs simpa [smul_neg, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc] using hpos' have hEq : f (x + s (-y)) = f x + s * (-v) := le_antisymm hle hge simpa [s, smul_neg, neg_smul, neg_neg, mul_neg, neg_mul] using hEq

Definition 8.9.0. Let Unknown identifier `f`f be a proper convex function on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n with recession function . The set of vectors Unknown identifier `y`y such that is called the lineality space of the proper convex function Unknown identifier `f`f.

def Function.linealitySpace {n : Nat} (f0_plus : EuclideanSpace Real (Fin n) EReal) : Set (EuclideanSpace Real (Fin n)) := { y | f0_plus (-y) = -(f0_plus y) }
